text: Mike Mentzer (November 15, 1951June 10, 2001) was an American IFBB professional bodybuilder, businessman and author.https://www.fitwise.com/mike_mentzer_death.asphttps://www.musclememory.com/show.php?c=World+Amateur+Championships+-+IFBB&y;=1978 Mentzer was born in Pennsylvania. He started bodybuilding when he was 11 years old. He won several amateur bodybuilding competitions before turning professional in 1979, including the 1976 Mr. America title and the heavyweight division of the 1978 IFBB Mr. Universe. In late 1979, he won the heavyweight class of the Mr. Olympia, but lost in the overall to Frank Zane. In the 1980 Mr. Olympia he placed fourth in a tie with Boyer Coe behind Arnold Schwarzenegger, Chris Dickerson and Frank Zane. == References == Category:1951 births Category:2001 deaths Category:American bodybuilders
title: Mike Mentzer
